TopicTitle: APOLLO (SATURN-V with F1 & J2, APOLLO CSM, LEM, LLRV). by OLDD (v.1.4. 09.05.14)

Articles.Content:
Does anyone else have problems targetting the LM hatch?

YES!

Is there a mod that makes items targetable through action group, or maybe through a menu like how remotetech targets comsats?

Get Crew Manifest... You can transfer the Kerbs from the CM to the LM and back easy that way.

I would recommend using Ship Manifest instead. I used to use crew manifest but on ship manifest you also have the option to transfer science or fuel, also their is a 0.23.5 release unlike crew manifest.

YES!

Is there a mod that makes items targetable through action group, or maybe through a menu like how remotetech targets comsats?

Targetron good for targetting docking devices

Targetron good for targetting docking devices

good mod I use it also, Can we haz 1.1 please!!!!! Itching to try the new new CM.
Thanks for the quick reply and this awesome mod. You are a gentleman and a scholar.

good mod I use it also, Can we haz 1.1 please!!!!! Itching to try the new new CM.

Version 1.1. is up.

Edited April 11, 2014 by DennyTX
I tried loading the pre-made ship in the download and apparently there's something missing. Are there any parts in the ship files that aren't in the download?
Craft files are indeed not loading correctly could we get this fixed please
Working fine for me all parts loaded and so did all three craft files.
One question... the LM hatch. How do you switch to the lower view in IVA mode? I can look down from the seats but when I open the hatch door there is another hatch door there which I can't open.
I removed the FASA mod and it now loads the craft files so will need to check through the plugins to see whats doing it or if there is a duplicate somewhere

The LM is duplicate with FASA, so this might be causing problems.

I tend to use the LM from FASA with Denny's CM and because it has some tweaks that make it work better. FASA's docking ports are easier to catch with a right-click, the LM EVA works without messing with IVA, and the collision mesh is a bit of a better fit.

The only thing missing now is a decent CM IVA.... but still.... Remember this picture from the REAL Apollo 11?

Love this mod...

But there is something to note here. The contact probes were actually on three of the feet, not two. Pedantic score for NeoMorph heh.
You can do that, but the LEM will be unbalanced, because the leg with the ladder is heavier.

The new Service Module is nice and shiny, and it has a SIM bay. But is there a SIM bay cover? I couldn't find it, and it looks weird launching without it. Also, do you plan to put any experiments in the SIM bay?

I am really enjoying this mod so I did a Mun landing for my first official launch

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The earlier problem I had with craft not loading was 2 reflection plugins which was causing stuff to not work

Edited April 11, 2014 by Virtualgenius
I still can't get my Kerbals out of the lander lol.... I have to be doing something wrong.

One question... the LM hatch. How do you switch to the lower view in IVA mode? I can look down from the seats but when I open the hatch door there is another hatch door there which I can't open.

Hmm. Seems like you did not have RPM installed. It is REQUIRED for my version.

Also LEM has 3 swithes to animate pilots moving in it. One of it moves pilots to hatch. Also - RPM required. As well as for work of all internal instruments.

The only thing missing now is a decent CM IVA.... but still.... Remember this picture from the REAL Apollo 11?

http://i.imgur.com/EjXx0wN.png

Love this mod...

But there is something to note here. The contact probes were actually on three of the feet, not two. Pedantic score for NeoMorph heh.

Well. the story is following. We have 2 type of Legs. First is with contact probe, second - with ladder. Also KSP has symmetry, 1-2-3-4 etc. but symmetry 3 holds 120 degrees between items. so we cant place 3 legs with contact probes with 90 degrees symmetry and last one with ladder to the right place. I found a way. symmetry 2 for each kind of legs. Ladders are on backside and front side, probes are on left and right. This give as an opportunity to have 2 different items and 2 attach operations. Other way is to attach legs one by one, but we'll get 4 attach operations.

Craft files are indeed not loading correctly could we get this fixed please

Seems like intersections with FASA version of my LEM. You should remove it and its internal from FASA directory.

The LM is duplicate with FASA, so this might be causing problems.

I tend to use the LM from FASA with Denny's CM and because it has some tweaks that make it work better. FASA's docking ports are easier to catch with a right-click, the LM EVA works without messing with IVA, and the collision mesh is a bit of a better fit.

Yup indeed. There we got intersections. We must decide with Frizzank what to do...

PS: anybody know how to call forth animation when decoupling event and how to rename "decouple" to something other

Edited April 11, 2014 by DennyTX

It's impossible in stock, unfortunately. You'd need to write/request a plugin with an alternate moduleDecouple that does all this. This would come in handy for everyone, TBH, stock module is rathe limited in what it can do.

The CM docking probe and cone have the following line in the ModuleDockingNode section:

referenceAttachNode = dockingNode //top

But neither of them have a node defined as dockingNode in the cfg. I think this is causing the docking problems.

Hmm. Seems like you did not have RPM installed. It is REQUIRED for my version.

Also LEM has 3 swithes to animate pilots moving in it. One of it moves pilots to hatch. Also - RPM required. As well as for work of all internal instruments.

Weird thing is I had RPM already installed. I think I corrupted it when I installed Bobcat's American pack which has RPM in with it as well.

Just reinstalling RPM and seeing if that helps.
I have a glitch - Internal light switcher turn light on, but don't turn it off.

I have a glitch - Internal light switcher turn light on, but don't turn it off.

Me too not a mod breaking problem though.

I still can't get my Kerbals out of the lander lol.... I have to be doing something wrong.

Press C then right click once and look down, below the pitch and rool controller is a knob click it and the hatch will open and you can eva.
This may help you the black knob

Hmm. Seems like you did not have RPM installed. It is REQUIRED for my version.

Also LEM has 3 swithes to animate pilots moving in it. One of it moves pilots to hatch. Also - RPM required. As well as for work of all internal instruments.

Well. the story is following. We have 2 type of Legs. First is with contact probe, second - with ladder. Also KSP has symmetry, 1-2-3-4 etc. but symmetry 3 holds 120 degrees between items. so we cant place 3 legs with contact probes with 90 degrees symmetry and last one with ladder to the right place. I found a way. symmetry 2 for each kind of legs. Ladders are on backside and front side, probes are on left and right. This give as an opportunity to have 2 different items and 2 attach operations. Other way is to attach legs one by one, but we'll get 4 attach operations.

Seems like intersections with FASA version of my LEM. You should remove it and its internal from FASA directory.

Yup indeed. There we got intersections. We must decide with Frizzank what to do...

PS: anybody know how to call forth animation when decoupling event and how to rename "decouple" to something other

The name of the part at the top of the config is what is causing the conflict. I will put FASA in front of the ones im using since I have less parts to rename than you do.

You may want to remove the requirement for the door to be open to get in and out. It is a cool feature but many are confused by it, and some don't use RPM.
